mode.description: Represents the install mode for the object data

filename.description: file name used by client to rebuild the commit

size.description: Total size of the object in bytes

compressed.description: If the object is a compressed file or not

required-uncompressed-size.description: Number of bytes required for installing the object

chunk-size.description: The size of the buffers (in bytes) used to read and write (default is 128KiB).

skip.description: How many chunk-size blocks must be skipped in the source file

seek.description: How many chunk-size blocks must be skipped in the target file

count.description: How many chunk-size blocks must be copied from the source file to the target. The default value of -1 means all possible bytes until the end of the file

truncate.description: True if the file pointed to by the target_path should be open in truncate mode (erase content before writing)

filesystem.description: Filesystem type that must be used to mount device

target-path.description: Target path on which the object must be installed to (e.g., /vmlinuz). This is relative to the mount point. Field present when mode equals to copy or tarball

format?.description: Specifies whether the device should be formatted

mount-options.description: Options to mount the filesystem in device

1k_padding.description: If 1k-padding should be added in the head
